clinical_study.brief_title: Intra-operative Variation in Size of Brain Tumors After Craniotomy
clinical_study.official_title: Intra-operative Variation in Size of Brain Tumors After Craniotomy - Observational Comparative Imaging Study

brief_summary.textblock: We planned to evaluate the change in tumor dimensions of intraaxial parenchymal tumors after craniotomy by comparing the tumor size on intraoperative ultrasonography (IOUSG) with pre-operative CECT and CEMRI brain.

detailed_description.textblock: Background: No previous study to determine the intraoperative changes in the tumor dimensions had been undertaken previously. Objectives: We planned to evaluate the change in tumor dimensions of intraaxial parenchymal tumors after craniotomy by comparing the tumor size on intraoperative ultrasonography (IOUSG) with pre-operative CECT and CEMRI brain. Study Design: This was a prospective observational study. Participants: Patients aged 15-65 years undergoing surgery at SKIMS for intraaxial parenchymal intracranial tumors were included. Methods: Standard pre-operative CECT and CEMRI brain were done to measure tumor dimensions and compared with IOUSG.

primary_outcome.description: Change in tumor dimension, surface area and volume when comparing intraoperative ultrasound with pre-operative CEMRI and CECT brain

secondary_outcome.description: Change in the distance of tumor from dural surface as measured on intraoperative ultrasound when comparing it with pre-operative CEMRI and CECT brain

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship of tumor size change with other characteristics
secondary_outcome.description: Relationship of tumor size change with tumor consistency, tumor characteristics, histopathology, tumor location

arm_group.description: Patient's in whom there is increase in tumor size after craniotomy
Patient's in whom there was either no increase in tumor size or decrease in tumor size after craniotomy

study_pop.textblock: All patients above the age of 15 years conferring to Grade I and II of American Society of Anesthesiologist (ASA) physical status classification system undergoing elective intracranial tumor surgery at our institute in the specified period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients above the age of 15 years conferring to Grade I and II of American Society of Anesthesiologist (ASA) physical status classification system, undergoing elective craniotomy with intracranial tumor excision were included in this study. Patients with or without any neuro-deficit were also included. Only those patients in whom all the tumor dimensions could be defined with precision on pre-operative CECT, CEMRI and IOUSG were included in the final analysis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients' in whom there are multiple intracranial tumors (e.g. metastasis), deep seated tumors, inability to use IOUSG and in whom exact tumor dimensions cannot be defined either on pre-operative CECT/CEMRI or on IOUSG were excluded.
